channel.title: Cycling Holidays | NORTHEAST INDIA on North by Northeast Journeys | Active Travels in Northeast India
channel.description: Recent content in Cycling Holidays | NORTHEAST INDIA on North by Northeast Journeys | Active Travels in Northeast India

item.title: Arunachal Pradesh (East): Watershed of the Brahmaputra | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Birth of the Brahmaputra Valley This cycle tour of Eastern Arunachal Pradesh the eastern most state of India and Upper Assam takes you to the watershed of the mighty Brahmaputra River.

item.title: Meghalaya: The Abode of clouds | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: The Khasi and Jaintia hills explored on bicycles. Meghalayaâ€™ meaning the Abode of clouds is a green hilly state perched between the great plains of Bangladesh and that of Assam.

item.title: Assam & Arunachal Pradesh: The Brahmaputra explorer | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Cycling the physical heart of Northeastern India This tour takes you cycling along the length of the Brahmaputra River, across parts of Assam and Arunachal Pradesh.

item.title: Meghalaya: The Trans-Meghalaya Explorer | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Cycling the Garo, Khasi and Jaintia hills The Trans Meghalaya cycling tour takes us across the three hill ranges of the state.

item.title: Arunachal Pradesh (East): The Mishmi Hills Explorer | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Himalaya’s eastern flank on cycles The cycle tour of Mishmi Hills takes you to the far eastern flank of the Himalayas, this is where the mighty Himalayan chain ends (or starts).

item.title: Sikkim & W Bengal: Monastic Trail | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Of Mountains and Monastries This cycling tour of Sikkim and West Bengal takes us through East, South and Western districts of Sikkim and the Darjeeling district of West Bengal.

item.title: Arunachal Pradesh (West): The Himalayan High | CYCLE TOUR
item.description: Retracing the Dalai Lama’s exodus from Tibet This cycling tour of western Arunachal Pradesh takes you all the way to the periphery of beautiful Tawang, lying close to the trijuncture of India, Bhutan and Tibet.
